page.description: Return the extent of the array optional dimension for multidimensional arrays.
page.original:
&ltARRAY>.SIZE() Syntax Size as N = &ltARRAY>.SIZE( [ Dimension as N ] ) Size as N = Object_Address.CHOICE.LIST.SIZE() ArgumentDescription DimensionOptional. Default = 1. The index of the array dimension. Object_AddressThe address of a list or combo box on a form.
Description The &ltARRAY>.SIZE() method returns size of an array. Example The following shows how to get the size of a multi-dimensional array. dim xa[3,5] as C ?xa.size(1) = 3.000000 ?xa.size(2) = 5.000000 ?xa.dimensions() = 2.000000
The following example gets the size of the choice array and then re-dimensions it, adding 4 new elements. size = :customer:payment.choice.list.size() size = size + 4 :customer:payment.choice.list.redim(size)
See Also Array Functions and Methods
